subs.text: April 5

@ReasonedWriting @KenSmith I gave a talk at a class at CUNY yesterday and did an outline beforehand. I didn’t need to refer to it, because outlining it put the structure in my mind, and I could work from that as I lectured. [link]

subs.text: If Twitter and Facebook had been federated from the start, like the web or email, or the internet itself, the companies wouldn't be in any way responsible for what's posted on the network. They would just be one node and would be unable to cut anyone off.
subs.rawText: If Twitter and Facebook had been federated from the start, like the web or email, or the internet itself, the companies wouldn't be in any way responsible for what's posted on the network. They would just be one node and would be unable to cut anyone off.

subs.text: 1/4 BTW, people who think the web is "over" don't understand imho how technology flows. The web is basically repurposed Unix. It arrived the decade after the "PC revolution." Conventional wisdom said that Unix was a small niche OS that programmers liked, but users primarily used
subs.rawText: 1/4 BTW, people who think the web is "over" don't understand imho how technology flows. The web is basically repurposed Unix. It arrived the decade after the "PC revolution." Conventional wisdom said that Unix was a small niche OS that programmers liked, but users primarily used

subs.text: 2/4 Windows with a smattering of Mac. Along comes the web just as Bill Gates thought he had it all sewn up. Unix! When I first saw an HTTP url I thought "users will never do this." Six months later there were billboards on Hwy 101 in Marin with URLs on them. They were talking
subs.rawText: 2/4 Windows with a smattering of Mac. Along comes the web just as Bill Gates thought he had it all sewn up. Unix! When I first saw an HTTP url I thought "users will never do this." Six months later there were billboards on Hwy 101 in Marin with URLs on them. They were talking

subs.text: 3/4 about the web on radio and TV. Unix had the last laugh. So when the web reboots it might not be called the web. But look closely, at whatever geeky new technology people are raving about, and you'll see that at its core it's open technology. And that will build on the open

subs.text: WordPress is huge. I'm wondering if another blogging system could develop in competition with WordPress, using the same model they use. An open source base, with a commercial service. Or will evolution allow only one huge open source blogging system. [link]
subs.rawText:
WordPress is huge. 

I'm wondering if another blogging system could develop in competition with WordPress, using the same model they use. An open source base, with a commercial service.

Or will evolution allow only one huge open source blogging system.

https://t.co/dwVzdKyEwo

subs.text:
Another related thought.

Did you know Twitter is a feed reader?

It is except it's private, doesn't use RSS.

You could build a feed reader, based on RSS that had Twitter's user experience. It can be done. 

But why haven't RSS-based feed readers evolved to work like Twitter?
subs.rawText:
Another related thought.

Did you know Twitter is a feed reader?

It is except it's private, doesn't use RSS.

You could build a feed reader, based on RSS that had Twitter's user experience. It can be done. 

But why haven't RSS-based feed readers evolved to work like Twitter?

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis to an album, so a lot of us literally don't know what the people who came before us did. 

I did it myself when I was coming out of grad school. I could have gone to work in the minicomputer business, but their stack was to me incomprehensible...
subs.rawText:
@jeffjarvis to an album, so a lot of us literally don't know what the people who came before us did. 

I did it myself when I was coming out of grad school. I could have gone to work in the minicomputer business, but their stack was to me incomprehensible...

subs.text: @jeffjarvis ...what was comprehensible to me was the Apple II, so I got one and started developing. A few years later I was in silicon valley, had a company and was making a small fortune.
subs.rawText: @jeffjarvis ...what was comprehensible to me was the Apple II, so I got one and started developing. A few years later I was in silicon valley, had a company and was making a small fortune.

subs.text:
You can easily and quickly download all your files with a single command and you should do it frequently.

If you want it to keep running, help out next time there are new features, get involved in testing. Anyone can do it.

@FrancescoD_Ales @pierce I had a funny experience.

Then looked and found out there's one more episode to go. 

Whew.

subs.text: I sat down at the breakfast table to solve the Wordle puzzle for the day. I sad to solve it in less than a minute. Now what to do? Guess I have to get to work! ;-)
subs.rawText: I sat down at the breakfast table to solve the Wordle puzzle for the day. I sad to solve it in less than a minute. Now what to do? Guess I have to get to work! ;-)

subs.text: BTW -- I find that only my subconscious mind can solve the puzzle, to actually see the solution. I can analytically arrange for the clues to be available to my subconsciousl but the word pops into my mind in an instant. I have no awareness of what the process is.
subs.rawText: BTW -- I find that only my subconscious mind can solve the puzzle, to actually see the solution. I can analytically arrange for the clues to be available to my subconsciousl but the word pops into my mind in an instant. I have no awareness of what the process is.

subs.text: Usually I'm sure when I have the answer. Today I wasn't even sure the correct word was actually a word! What a nice surprise when all five letters came out green and then did their little dance. 😍
subs.rawText: Usually I'm sure when I have the answer. Today I wasn't even sure the correct word was actually a word! What a nice surprise when all five letters came out green and then did their little dance. 😍

subs.text: @KenSmith heh this is a question i've been asking for years. in the early days of blogging i tried to get an online news group to pop up to cover Linux. it didn't happen. as long as i was pushing it myself it had momentum, when i stepped back, nothing.
subs.rawText: @KenSmith heh this is a question i've been asking for years. in the early days of blogging i tried to get an online news group to pop up to cover Linux. it didn't happen. as long as i was pushing it myself it had momentum, when i stepped back, nothing.

subs.text:
@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.

subs.text:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice. 

I don't know that there's any other way out of the problem. Writing about it publicly only makes it worse I found. Very little sympathy out there for the person at or near the top.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice. 

I don't know that there's any other way out of the problem. Writing about it publicly only makes it worse I found. Very little sympathy out there for the person at or near the top.

subs.text: @TaylorLorenz Some of the abuse came from people who worked for the big tech companies who were threatened by the work we were doing, btw. Hard to say if the companies put them up to it, but I'm sure it didn't hurt their careers.
subs.rawText: @TaylorLorenz Some of the abuse came from people who worked for the big tech companies who were threatened by the work we were doing, btw. Hard to say if the companies put them up to it, but I'm sure it didn't hurt their careers.

subs.text: I‘m blocking everyone who posts a “joke” today.
subs.rawText: I‘m blocking everyone who posts a “joke” today.

subs.text: I can’t believe that supposedly legit news orgs post stories that are supposed to be jokes but are stupid lies. They do it every year. I try to remember each one, and never to take them seriously again.
